sub_title: Founder at BrandAide | The art and science of building beautiful brands with strength, integrity, and business significance.
summary:
Olga is the founder of BrandAide, a consultancy building beautiful brands scientifically primed for sustainable growth. Uniting art, science, and business expertise to build brands that excel.

Strategically applying key principles of neuroscience to all elements of the brand building ecosystem, BrandAide’s unique methodology is proven to hyper-excite consumers’ brains to achieve sustainable growth. Anticipating and acting on buyers’ (sub)conscious wants and needs, so your brand becomes their instinctual preference. By understanding the human mind, we create brand building activities that influence consumer choice. Crafting experiences, products, and businesses that stand out, are easy to process, and drive strong emotional connections with customers. 

Prior to founding BrandAide, Olga was Design and Brand Experience Leader for Procter & Gamble’s Global Prestige Beauty, Fragrances, and Hair Care portfolios. She was a driving, visionary force enabling growth for iconic beauty and luxury brands. 

Her most remarkable P&G legacy is her study of over 100 iconic brands, synthesizing the fundamentals of their success to apply these to turning brands around. Combining this with her expertise in cognitive science, she incorporated key drivers of human attention, memory, emotion, and decision-making into the brand portfolio.  

Olga's passion for capability-building led to the creation of P&G’s Eye On Beauty, a bespoke mobile app to elevate the beauty eye, mind, and craft of the organization. An inspiring, indulgent, personalized, and convenient tool to foster a growth mindset, promote collective intelligence, and make employees’ unique knowledge accessible to others. 

Prior to P&G, Olga was Design Director for Glamour Magazine (Condé Nast Publications) in New York. 

As a pioneer in the application of Cognitive Science to Brand Building, Olga lectures internationally on the subject. She is the author of “An Eye for Color,” analyzing the finest color usage in art, design, fashion, and nature. Her work has appeared in major design publications, featured in exhibits in the USA, Korea, and Spain, and won numerous international awards. 

Olga was a Professor at the Pratt Institute in New York for over 10 years, teaching graduate students in Visual Communication, Packaging, Typography, and Editorial Design. 

Creative & Brand Executive | Brand Building | Brand Experience | Design & Product Innovation | Visual Communication | Advertising | App Development | Social & Ecommerce Platforms | Retail Architecture | Publishing | Editorial | UX Design | Design Thinking

school.name: European Center of Gemology and Jewelry
School of Arts and Crafts, Oviedo, Spain

awards.title: P&G Brand Mastery Society Award
awards.description:
The Brand Mastery Society Awards recognizes the best of P&G Brand Builders for demonstrating sustained excellence, pioneering groundbreaking innovations, building mastery in others, and contributing superior value to consumers and the company through brands over multiple years. 

Innovative methodology design, the integration of Cognitive Science principles into Brand Building, and her wide network of key agency partners led Olga to receive this prestigious award.

awards.title: 20 design awards, design exhibits, interviews, and features in international design publications
awards.description:
Olga’s work has been featured in design exhibits in the USA, Korea, and Spain and appeared in major international design publications. 

SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS
• DK FESTIVAL, Rovinj, Croatia, 2022 — The Era of Neurodesign
• DIGITAL DESIGN DAYS, virtual, 2020 — Cognitive Science in the times of Covid
• DIGITAL DESIGN DAYS, Geneva, Switzerland, 2019 — Cognitive Science applied to Digital Communication
• PACKAGING DESIGN AND INNOVATION SUMMIT, Berlin, Germany, 2018 — Designing Packaging for the “busy” mind to enhance positive emotional appeal and stand out at shelf
• EUROPACK SUMMIT, Montreaux, Switzerland, 2016 — Cognitive Science applied to Packaging
• FUSE, Chicago 2011 — "Building Iconic Brands" 
• MOTIVA (Graphic Design Conference), School of Arts & Crafts, Spain 2003 — "Typography in the USA" 
• New York Institute of Technology, USA 2003 — "Typography in Editorial and Logotypes" 
• New York City College of Technology/CUNY, USA 2003 — "Passion and Profession" 

OTHER ENGAGEMENTS
• LE BOOK CONNECTIONS DIGITAL EUROPE jury, 2019-2021

AWARDS AND EXHIBITIONS
• 2000 Kyongnam International Design Exhibition. Changwon Culture and Arts Center in Kyongnam, Korea.
• Pratt Institute, New York, September 2000. Passion and Profession — a Solo Graphic Design Exhibition.
• Awards: Creativity 99 and 98, Print Regional 98, The Visual Awards 96, Summit National Awards 96, Addy Awards 96 and 95, AME International Awards 95, Hispanic Awards 95, Summit Awards 95, Austrian Press Logo Competition 93

TELEVISION AND PRESS
• Design in New York, South Korea: 2004 book feature
• Design Jungle, South Korea: 2003 website interview
• Oviedo Diario, Spain: 2003 newspaper interview
• Tele Gijón, Spain: 2003 television interview 
• Localia, Spain: 2003 television interview
• Cambio 16, Spain: 2000 newspaper interview
• La Voz de Asturias, Spain: 2000 newspaper interview
• La Nueva España, Spain: 2000 newspaper interview
• CNN international, USA: 1998 television interview

authors.headline: Founder at BrandAide | The art and science of building beautiful brands with strength, integrity, and business significance.

profile_positions.description:
BrandAide believes that brands shouldn’t just preach, promise, and trade. They have a responsibility to create positive impact on our lives and the world, through strength, integrity, and significance. 

Building brands that capture consumers’ eyes, hearts, and minds — for life.

BrandAide has an extensive network of international agencies, designers, and artists, connecting the finest industry minds to transform the brands we touch into a business competitive advantage.

Website coming soon.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: Design Leader for the P&G Global Hair Care Brands portfolio (Pantene, Head & Shoulders, Herbal Essences, Aussie, Vidal Sassoon, Hair Recipe, Rejoice). Developed and implemented an End-to-End Brand Experience framework and built key business and portfolio capabilities across Brand Building, Packaging, Retail, and Social/Digital Platforms.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Design Hair Care
Global Hair Care Design Director and Pantene Brand Experience Leader

profile_positions.description: Led P&G’s Prestige Beauty Global Design, with a category portfolio of 18+ Global Fashion Fragrances and Luxury Skin brands (SKII, Gucci, D&G, Hugo Boss, Stella McCartney, Alexander McQueen, Escada, Lacoste, Puma, Rochas). Managed an integrated global team of 40+ Industrial Designers, Graphic Designers, and Architects, overseeing Front-End Design Innovation, Packaging, Brand Identity, and Go-To-Market Design.
profile_positions.title: Prestige Beauty and EMEA Design Director

profile_positions.description: Led Global Design across Hair Care, a 12bn-dollar business with 30+ brands, across Design Innovation, Packaging, and Retail Design.
profile_positions.title: Global Hair, Color, and Professional Care Design Director

profile_positions.description: Led Design for P&G’s Latin America portfolio of 250 brands across Fabric & Home Care, Oral, Baby, Health Care, and Beauty & Grooming. Created and established the first P&G R&D/Design Innovation Center dedicated to developing markets. Pioneered a new Regional Design Retail capability to elevate the shopping experience via category and channel-specific solutions.
profile_positions.title: Latin America Design Leader

profile_positions.description: Design Director and Management Team Member for Glamour Magazine, one of Condé Nast’s most profitable businesses. Designed multi-million dollar promotional programs for 200+ major international brands, ranging from prestige to mass-market across beauty, fashion, household, automotive, and health.
profile_positions.title: Design Director Publishing, Glamour Magazine

profile_positions.description: Assistant Professor for Typography, Visual Communication, and thesis projects. Taught, mentored, and directed students in the Graduate Program, promoting teamwork and motivating students to create award-winning material. Invited Guest Lecturer at the Fashion Institute of Technology, New York City College of Technology/CUNY, New York Institute of Technology, and the School of Arts and Crafts in Oviedo, Spain.
profile_positions.title: Professor at Visual Communications & Packaging Design Master's Program

profile_positions.description: Art directed award-winning Hispanic market campaigns for McDonald's and Coca-Cola.
profile_positions.title: Advertising Art Director
